<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 752, 92]]<|/det|>
The solutions of the equation \(|4x - 1| = |x + 3|\) are \(x = p\) and \(x = q\), where \(p < q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 103, 823, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the exact values of \(p\) and \(q\), and hence determine the exact value of \(|p - 2| - |q - 1|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 87, 636, 330]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 351, 920, 402]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = A x^{k}\), where \(A\) and \(k\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(\ln x\) is a straight line passing through the points (0.56, 2.87) and (0.81, 3.47), as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 413, 670, 432]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\), and the value of \(A\) correct to 2 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 413, 920, 432]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 730, 92]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) lies between 1.8 and 1.9.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 510, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part (a), to find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) correct to 3 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 528, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 87, 645, 297]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 316, 920, 364]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curves \(y = \frac{6}{3x + 2}\) and \(y = 3\mathrm{e}^{- x} - 3\) for values of \(x\) between 0 and 4. The shaded region is bounded by the two curves and the lines \(x = 0\) and \(x = 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 375, 811, 395]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region, giving your answer in the form \(\ln a + b + c\mathrm{e}^{d}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 377, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 843, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve at \(Q\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures. [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[490, 950, 549, 965]]<|/det|>
<mark>[O]
